meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - I'm back with another groovy review to get your gaming spirits soaring!

Marvel's Avengers has landed on my digital doorstep, and it's time to share my two cents (or in this case, my pixelated opinions). Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is it just another Lego game?" Well, buckle up, folks, because TT Games brings the fun, wit, and superheroes galore!

Now, let's get the critic's corner rolling. GameSpot gave it a solid 70, stating that it's tough to go back to the old Lego formula after the inventiveness of Lego Dimensions. I agree - it's like trying to put a square peg in a round hole (or in this case, a Lego brick in a... well, you get the idea). But Marvel's Avengers mostly staves off franchise fatigue thanks to its fast-paced, cheery nature. You know what to expect if you've played a recent Lego game: another familiar and fun adventure that's perfect for sharing with your mini-mes!

Game Informer chimed in with an 78, praising the game's humor and poking fun at Marvel movies (because let's be honest, those films can be a bit... intense). The gameplay is quite good, but it's not without its rough edges. I mean, who doesn't love a little humor and wit in their games?

Gaming Age gave it a 75, suggesting that if you haven't played Lego Marvel Super Heroes, start with that one first (unless you're a Marvel fanatic, of course!). Either way, suit up for some mighty heroes!

Cheat Code Central awarded it an 80, delighting in TT Games' trademark humor and playfulness. I mean, who wouldn't want to spend hours playing as their favorite superheroes and searching for Stan Lee cameos? (RIP, Stan). A few obtuse objectives and level flow issues keep me from giving it a perfect score, but hey, that's just part of the wild ride!

Vandal echoed similar sentiments with an 80, stating that TT Games still manages to create new adventures that are fun and engaging. Unless you're tired of Lego games (which I highly doubt), this is a pretty good option!

SpazioGames gave it a 70, lamenting the formula becoming stale but acknowledging the amazing amount of playable characters and a fun campaign. Time for a big change? Maybe not just yet!

GamingTrend crowned Marvel's Avengers with an impressive 85, praising its ties to the cinematic universe (even if it's less imaginative than its comic book predecessor) and excellent superhero gameplay. This is one of the best Lego games yet, and a must-play for any Marvel fan!

So there you have it - my hippo-pedal review! What do you think? Are you ready to join the Avengers and save the world from boredom?
